body:
I am still not clear on how to make spack play nice with existing modules, and need some help.

Say my environment already have "cmake/3.9.2" available as a module compiled with gcc@4.8.5
and I want to install `protobuf` at the latest version. My compiler setting is 6.4.0 by default. The "concretization" shows that `protobuf` want to run with `cmake/3.12.2` with `gcc@6.4.0`. 

I want to instruct spack to use existing cmake module by:
```
spack install protobuf%gcc@6.4.0 cmake@3.9.2%gcc@4.8.5
```

This doesn't seem work - spack insists on installing a new cmake.  Any help?
title: how to ask spack to use existing module?
